column1: #Text=( kreyòl ayisyen ) is one of the official languages of Haiti along with French .
#Text=The former is spoken by 8.5 million people in Haiti , which is nearly the entire population .
#Text=It is also spoken by large Haitian communities in several nearby countries , among the United States , the Bahamas , the Dominican Republic , Cuba , and French Guiana .

#Text=It is based on 18th century French and several West and Central Africa n languages with minor Spanish influence . 90 % of Haitian Creole is based on French , although it differs greatly from standard French because of the lack of grammatical gender and verb inflection .
#Text=Creole pronunciation is very phonetic , unlike French — the language it 's based on .
#Text=If you can make friends with a Haitian who speaks English , they will usually be glad to help with your pronunciation .
#Text=Sounds marked with an asterisk ( * ) are particularly difficult for English speakers .
#Text=The nasal sounds can be pronounced as if the ' n ' were not there , and the ' r ' can be pronounced as a ' w. ' While not quite correct , these pronunciations will be generally understandable .
#Text=Nasal sounds are pronounced without fully articulating the ' n. ' Think making the sound , but stopping 3/4 of the way through the ' n. '
#Text=r* : /ɣ/ no English equivalent , but pronounced like the ' r ' in French
#Text=How are you ? : Koman ou yè ? ( KOH-mah oo yay ? )
#Text=Not bad . : Pa pi mal . ( pah pee mahl )
#Text=Excuse me . ( getting attention ) : Eskise 'm . ( es-KEEZ-eh m )
#Text=I ca n't speak kreyol . : Mwen pa kap pale kreyol . ( mway pah kahp PAH-lay kway-OHL )
#Text=Eske ou pale Angle ? ( ES-kay oo PAH-lay on-GLAY ? )
#Text=Is there someone here who speaks English ? :
#Text=I do n't understand . : Mwen pa konprann .
#Text=How much is a ticket ? : Konben koute biye ?
#Text=Does this bus stop in ____ ? : Tap la arete nan ____ ?
#Text=How do I get to ____ ? : Koumon mwen pve ale o ____ ?
#Text=How much does it cost ? : Konbyen sa koute ?
#Text=I will give you ____ . : Si mewn ba ou ____ .
